revised_title: On the Theory of Light and Colours: A Bakerian Lecture
tldr: In this lecture, Thomas Young presents a comprehensive overview of the undulatory theory of light, explaining how the sensation of different colors depends on the frequency of vibrations in the retina. He also discusses the role of the luminiferous ether in the propagation of light and its refraction, providing a detailed analysis of various phenomena, including the colors of striated surfaces, thin plates, and thick plates.
